answers.answer: I am so happy for you!That weight loss will continue for sure! Now you know what you are dealing with, diet will help greatly.Keep on being 'normal' !Hugs!
Thanks sweetie.  Now you helped me.  What can I do for you?  I will wing over every prayer and good thought until you get to feeling better too.  : )
Awww, you are too kind. You could kick some doctor's butts for me though! LOL!

question: My scan is clean.  There is no recurrence and no sign of anything to worry about.  : )  Yay.For those of you who do not know me...I found out in Feb 09 that I had thyroid cancer.  two weeks later I had my thyroid out in my first ever surgery.  Why start out small after all.  I had found the folks here at med help and OMG...they got me thru the worse time.  I rec'd encouragement and learned things.  Sometimes I felt like I was learning more than what my drs knew at the time.  It took three drs to even get the correct diagnosis.  But long story...well....long... I just had the nastiest year of my life and didn't even realize until summer this year, that I actually missed out on a lot of life during those months.  I was tired and pretty much just took every day one day at a time and just continued to put one foot in front of the other.  I did start to feel some better along about Oct.  My meds were right at that time and in Nov I actually lost 8 lbs.  (only 100 left to go) Then everything just sort of stopped again.  I felt better but wasn't really putting much effort forth.About a month ago, I was diagnosed very early with diabetes. JEEEZ what's next right?  I am attempting to control it with my diet. Lower carbs than I ate before and I have lost 30 lbs. I FEEL GREAT.There is life after thyroidectomy.  It took me a year and a half.  I will have another scan probably in another year and I will be edgy and gritchy for the week that I have to wait for the results.  But today is a good day.Thanks again to all my friends.  For now, I am clear.  I was going to say normal, but well, that just means so many things that I will never be.  LOL  Have a great night everyone.
title: Full body scan 1.5 years after TT
